page.title: 04HELPING THE INJURED
page.content: {Higham Grange-the Rehabilitation {Centre}situated on the Watling Street near Nuneaton-employs 40 staff and has accommodation for 54 resident males and 18-30 day patients including women and children. Casualties of{industrial,road and {'Do-it-yourself' accidents}receive treatment here.A large heated pool is available for Hydrotherapy. Physiotherapy and remedial gymnastics are practised, together with prework therapy on a model coal face,building site, car workshop,lorry driving etc. {Patients are drawn from all over {the Midlands.}Consultants from the main Midlands Hospitals and Medical Officers from the National Coal Board attend the Centre to discuss the progress and resettlement of the patients.
